ü©∫ env-doctor

Analyze and validate environment variables in your codebase

Detect missing, unused, and misconfigured environment variables before they cause runtime errors. Framework-aware scanning for Next.js, Vite, and more.

Get Started ‚ÜíLearn More
npx env-doctor

Features

Everything you need to keep your environment variables healthy

üîç Missing Variable Detection

Find environment variables used in your code that aren't defined in your .env files.

üßπ Unused Variable Detection

Identify variables defined in .env but never referenced in your codebase.

üîê Secret Detection

Detect exposed API keys, tokens, and credentials with built-in patterns for 20+ services.

üìä Type Validation

Catch type mismatches like using parseInt() on non-numeric values.

üîÑ Sync Check

Keep .env and .env.example in sync automatically.

‚ö° Framework Support

Auto-detect Next.js, Vite, and CRA with framework-specific rules.

See It In Action

Run a single command to analyze your entire codebase. Get instant feedback on missing variables, exposed secrets, and configuration issues.

  • ‚úì AST-based scanning for accurate detection
  • ‚úì Framework-aware (Next.js, Vite, CRA)
  • ‚úì SARIF output for GitHub Code Scanning
  • ‚úì Interactive fix mode
Quick Start Guide
$ npx env-doctor

env-doctor v1.0.0

Framework: nextjs
Scanned 42 files, 12 env variables

‚úó Missing Variables (2 issues)

  DATABASE_URL
    Variable "DATABASE_URL" is used in code but not defined
    at src/lib/db.ts:5

  API_SECRET
    Required variable is not defined

‚ö† Unused Variables (1 issue)

  OLD_API_KEY
    Defined in .env but never used

‚úì Sync Check
  .env and .env.example are in sync

Summary: 2 errors, 1 warning
Completed in 156ms

CI/CD Integration

Add env-doctor to your CI pipeline in minutes

# .github/workflows/env-check.yml
name: Environment Check

on: [push, pull_request]

jobs:
  env-doctor:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      - run: npx env-doctor --ci --format sarif > results.sarif
      - uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v3
        with:
          sarif_file: results.sarif
View CI/CD Guide
